intro: Cryptantha micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, pea-like flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its small, rounded leaves and clustered flowers make it a distinctive member of the genus Cryptantha. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions.
